artist: Artist: Utagawa Hiroshige; Publisher: Ibaya Senzaburō
creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
markings: publisher seal: {Dansendō}; LRC: red collector seal: [AM]
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Journey to Seven Hot Springs of Hakone (Hakone shichi-yu meguri no uchi 箱根七湯巡之内)
text: Miyanoshita, one of the seven hot springs in Hakone area, is located on a steep embankment above a mountain stream. Affording a breathtaking view of the mountains that rise on the opposite side of the valley, the inns of Miyanoshita were a particularly relaxing retreat to the visitors. On the path leading to the inns, Hiroshige placed a group of such travelers. They look admiringly at the dramatic scenery and one man even dances with joy.
title: Miyanoshita
